intro: Capsella pinnata, commonly known as the heartleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. The plant is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other flowering vines and herbs. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Capsella pinnata is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, where it spreads by seeds dispersed by wind and animals.
